meanings.definition: To exaggerate or overemphasize the importance or effect of something.
meanings.sent1: She always overplayed her achievements, making them seem bigger than they really were.
meanings.sent2: He overplayed his excitement about the new toy, jumping up and down with joy.
meanings.sent3: The way he overplayed his fear of spiders was so dramatic, it made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her tendency to overplay her emotions turned every small issue into a major crisis.
meanings.sent5: The magician overplayed his surprise at the disappearing rabbit, making the audience gasp in amazement.

meanings.definition: To perform (a role or piece of music) too often or too frequently.
meanings.sent1: The actor overplayed the villain in every play he was in, making it less impactful.
meanings.sent2: The band overplayed their hit song at every concert, causing some fans to get tired of it.
meanings.sent3: The pianist overplayed the same tune repeatedly, driving the audience crazy with boredom.
meanings.sent4: The comedian overplayed his signature joke, losing its charm with each repetition.
meanings.sent5: The radio station overplayed the popular song, making listeners switch to a different channel.

meanings.definition: To tire or bore someone by excessive repetition or use.
meanings.sent1: The constant commercials overplayed during the movie breaks annoyed the audience.
meanings.sent2: The teacher overplayed the same lesson for weeks, making the students lose interest.
meanings.sent3: His repeated requests for attention overplayed his neediness, pushing people away.
meanings.sent4: The old joke was overplayed at every family gathering, losing its humor over time.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive sound of the dripping faucet overplayed in her mind, keeping her awake at night.
